ResourceHeader.ResourceName: Venus Express ASPERA-4 Neutral Particle Imager
ResourceHeader.Description: The Neutral Particle Imager (NPI) of the ASPERA-4 package flown on Venus Express provides measurements of the integral ENA flux with no mass and energy resolution but with 4.6 deg x 11.5 deg angular resolution. The intrinsic field of view is 9 deg x 344 deg. The sensor utilizes a graphite surface to suppress the UV background. ENAs incident on the surface at a grazing angle of 20 deg are reflected and/or cause ion sputtering. An MCP stack detects the reflected particles and sputtered fragments with a discrete anode.
